snippet: For Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the surviving suspect in the Boston Marathon bombing, there were oblique signs to those around him that the gulf between the private and the public person was widening.
abstract: Profile of Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, surviving suspect in Boston Marathon bombing; those close to him remain baffled by his turn toward extremism, even as it becomes clear that there were oblique signs of widening gulf between his private life and his public person in months leading up to bombing.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and IAN LOVETT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jennifer Preston, Serge F. Kovaleski and Emily Rueb from New York; Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Dina Kraft from Cambridge; Kitty Bennett from St. Petersburg, Fla.; and Leanne Poirier from North Dartmouth, Mass.

lead_paragraph: For Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the surviving suspect in the Boston Marathon bombing, there were oblique signs to those around him that the gulf between the private and the public person was widening.

headline.seo: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev’s Dark Side, Carefully Masked
